record.description: Yehudi Menuhin, renowned violinist, speaks with a well-wisher at the reception following his receipt of the University's Rosenberger medal. Only two other Rosenberger medals have been awarded to musicians; Frederick Stock received one in 1941 and the Juilliard string quartet in 1973. Mr. Menuhin also gave a lecture-demonstration for members of the University.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: UC Magazine, Spring, 1976issue, see pp. 34. Id's one of the Yehudi photos as by Clyde Watkins-all photos are part of series of contact prints and therefore must be by Clyde Watkins.
